title: David Knowles (footballer)
text:
John David Knowles (1941 – 26 January 2011) was an English professional <a href="association%20football">footballer</a> who played as a <a href="Goalkeeper%20%28association%20football%29">goalkeeper</a>. He played for <a href="Halifax%20Town%20A.F.C.">Halifax Town</a>, <a href="Bury%20F.C.">Bury</a> and <a href="Bradford%20City%20A.F.C.">Bradford City</a>.
Career.
Born in <a href="Halifax%2C%20West%20Yorkshire">Halifax</a>, in 1941, Knowles attended Clare Hall County Secondary Modern School, playing <a href="association%20football">football</a> for the school side and the Halifax representative side. He joined hometown team <a href="Halifax%20Town%20A.F.C.">Halifax Town</a> at the age of 17 and signed professional forms six months later, going on to make 72 appearances in <a href="the%20Football%20League">the Football League</a> over the next six seasons. Knowles later played for <a href="Bury%20F.C.">Bury</a>, making just one league appearance, before spending a final season with <a href="Bradford%20City%20A.F.C.">Bradford City</a>. He waited until the third game of the 1966–67 season to make his debut for City, which came against <a href="Bradford%20derby">city rivals</a> <a href="Bradford%20Park%20Avenue%20A.F.C.">Bradford (Park Avenue)</a> in a 3–2 defeat, going on to play 21 games.
Later life and death.
After retiring as a player, Knowles became <a href="postmaster">postmaster</a> of <a href="Oakenshaw%2C%20West%20Yorkshire">Oakenshaw</a>. He married Jennifer, with whom he had two children, Heather and Ian. Knowles died on 26 January 2011 at the age of 69, in Elm Royd Nursing Home, <a href="Brighouse">Brighouse</a>, following a long illness.
